result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Reece A. Perrigo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Treatment Court Plea Agreement
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months
Treatment Court Hearing on June 8, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been approved for the Treatment Court Program.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1, 2 & 3.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on Ct. 1.  
Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the information for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 24 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1.

Atty Hendee states that the parties have submitted a Marquette County Treatment Court plea agreement and asks the court to go through that document with the defendant.
Court questions the defendant on that plea agreement.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1: 24 month DPA with conditions.

  TREATMENT COURT PROGRAM:
Counts 2 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 2; Stayed for Treatment Court sanctions
Court Costs = $243.00 x 2
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge x 2
Participation and Successful completion of the Treatment Court Program
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court which adds Counts 2 & 3.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  
  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 15, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant's case has been discussed by the Treatment Court Team but an evaluation date needs to be done by Mr. Webb.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks for this to be set May 15th for a plea.

BY THE COURT: Set for Plea date.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

OFF THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz and Atty Hendee received a message that Mr. Webb is not available until May 15th; will reset Plea/Sentencing.
Return date on May 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that a referral has been done to Ms. Runge for Treatment Court; if there is a recommendation for the program the parties will have resolution.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give time for Treatment Court evaluation.
bond continued  Return date scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on April 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
*No special conditions

Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.
Court questions the defendant.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; Set for Return

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant Reece A. Perrigo. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court. Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:  Return date scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
